subject: Linux 6.10

technical.details: Minimal change to Makefile for release version bump

impact.details: Major kernel release affecting all users

quality.details: Standard release commit format, atomic change

community.details: Release by Linus Torvalds as maintainer

score_justification: Official Linux 6.10 release commit by Linus Torvalds, minimal code change but significant milestone
code_snippet:
@@ -2,7 +2,7 @@
 VERSION = 6
 PATCHLEVEL = 10
 SUBLEVEL = 0
-EXTRAVERSION = -rc7
+EXTRAVERSION =
 NAME = Baby Opossum Posse
 
 # *DOCUMENTATION*

subject: fortify: fix warnings in fortify tests with KASAN

technical.details: Minimal Makefile change (4 lines) to build system affecting fortify tests across architectures. Touches kbuild (tier 3) with implications for security testing infrastructure.

impact.details: BUILD-FIX (base 8) resolving regression from 9c2d1328f88a. Fixes tag indicates backport candidate. Impacts developer experience (test warnings) rather than runtime. Standard fix pattern.

quality.details: Self-committed by build maintainer. Excellent message with root cause analysis, architecture-specific context, and regression linkage. Implicit verification via fixing test warnings.

community.details: Reported-by Arnd Bergmann (cross-org collaboration). Committed by kbuild maintainer. Responsive fix to reported issue with detailed explanation.

score_justification: Build system fix resolving architecture-specific test warnings caused by KASAN flag handling regression. Minimal code change (4 lines) but demonstrates deep understanding of build infrastructure, sanitizer interactions, and cross-architecture compatibility. High-quality commit message with thorough root cause analysis.
code_snippet:
@@ -426,3 +426,7 @@ $(obj)/$(TEST_FORTIFY_LOG): $(addprefix $(obj)/, $(TEST_FORTIFY_LOGS)) FORCE
 ifeq ($(CONFIG_FORTIFY_SOURCE),y)
 $(obj)/string.o: $(obj)/$(TEST_FORTIFY_LOG)
 endif
+
+# Some architectures define __NO_FORTIFY if __SANITIZE_ADDRESS__ is undefined.
+# Pass CFLAGS_KASAN to avoid warnings.
+$(foreach x, $(patsubst %.log,%.o,$(TEST_FORTIFY_LOGS)), $(eval KASAN_SANITIZE_$(x) := y))
